$interpreted: Clio: What a drag...Thanks to Clovis' stubbornness, I'll be stuck with all this extra work tomorrow.
Zola: ...Sister Shirley, how long has it been?
Clio: Zola, you almost got busted. Lucky for you, some oblivious student was there at just the right time.
Zola: Even if I were discovered, it wouldn't have been an issue. I am confident that I could escape.
Shirley: What I meant is that you...whatever. What is the next step?
Zola: The higher-ups think that the surveillance here is just about complete. The Second Parhelion has ordered you to conclude the mission here right away.
Zola: Afterward, other spies will come and take over.
Shirley: But I'm so close to uncovering Dietrich's research...
Zola: The order has come directly from the Second Parhelion.
Zola: Sister Shirley, I don't want you to be punished. Just come back with me, okay?
Shirley: I need at least one more day, just one more day.
Zola: If you insist on doing so, then the Second One may come for you in person.
Shirley: .........
Zola: But if what you want is those in the Academy to have a good impression of you...
Shirley: ...I'll go destroy all the information concerning Clio immediately.
Zola: Sister Shirley...I'll be waiting.
Shirley: Being a student is so wonderful...
Shirley: Even though it was all a lie...
Aosta: I was wondering who was sneaking out in the middle of the night...Turns out it was you, Fournier. So, tell me. Where are you planning to go?
Shirley: Clovis, you'll never change. Just a little off with your timing.
Shirley: But, unfortunately for you, I don't have time to explain. My mission is over, so I've got to go.
Aosta: Mission? What mission? Where are you going?
Shirley: None of your business.
Aosta: ...If it concerns Professor Dietrich, then it's very much my business. I'm not letting you walk away so easily!

Aosta: You...you're...
Looks like my intuition was correct...
Shirley: Intuition?
Aosta: You always kept yourself at a distance when you're with us.
Aosta: I could tell you're not someone who belongs here.
Aosta: Erghhh...
Shirley: Perhaps...That's why I'm envious of you...
Shirley: Send Professor Dietrich my regards.
Shirley: I really did want to help Professor put on a successful conference.
Shirley: But it looks like I'll just have to entrust that to you...

...Sister Shirley, how long has it been?

Being a student is so wonderful...
Even though it was all a lie...

Clovis, you'll never change. Just a little off with your timing.
But, unfortunately for you, I don't have time to explain. My mission is over, so I've got to go.
Mission? What mission? Where are you going?
None of your business.
...If it concerns Professor Dietrich, then it's very much my business. I'm not letting you walk away so easily!

You...you're...
Looks like my intuition was correct...
Intuition?
You always kept yourself at a distance when you're with us.
I could tell you're not someone who belongs here.
Erghhh...
Perhaps...That's why I'm envious of you...
Send Professor Dietrich my regards.
I really did want to help Professor put on a successful conference.
But it looks like I'll just have to entrust that to you...
